static_content.question: Will you serve mostly static content (e.g., HTML, images, assets)?

suggested_answers.label: Yes, mostly static content
suggested_answers.description: HTML, CSS, JS, and images served directly without server processing

suggested_answers.label: No, mostly dynamic content
suggested_answers.description: Content generated on each request from databases or APIs

suggested_answers.label: A mix of both
suggested_answers.description: Static assets combined with dynamic API-driven pages

api_backend.question: Do you need a backend API that clients or other services will call?

suggested_answers.label: No API
suggested_answers.description: Frontend-only application with no server-side logic

suggested_answers.label: Simple API
suggested_answers.description: Basic CRUD operations with a few endpoints

suggested_answers.label: Core of the product is an API
suggested_answers.description: API-first design with complex business logic and integrations

user_authentication.question: Will users need to sign up and log in?

suggested_answers.label: No login
suggested_answers.description: Public access only, no user accounts required

suggested_answers.label: Advanced authentication and roles
suggested_answers.description: OAuth, SSO, MFA, and role-based access control

multi_tenancy.question: Is this system for a single customer or many customers (multi-tenant SaaS)?

suggested_answers.label: Single customer or internal only
suggested_answers.description: One organization uses the system exclusively

suggested_answers.label: A few customers
suggested_answers.description: Small number of customers with separate data

suggested_answers.label: Multi-tenant SaaS for many customers
suggested_answers.description: Shared infrastructure serving hundreds of customers

file_storage.question: Do users upload or store files (images, videos, docs)?

suggested_answers.label: No file uploads
suggested_answers.description: No user-generated files or media storage

suggested_answers.label: Heavy file usage (lots of storage)
suggested_answers.description: Large media files, video streaming, or bulk uploads

realtime_updates.question: Do you need realtime updates (e.g., live dashboards, notifications, WebSockets)?

suggested_answers.label: No realtime
suggested_answers.description: Standard request-response only, page refresh for updates

suggested_answers.label: Some realtime features
suggested_answers.description: Live notifications, basic chat, or activity feeds

suggested_answers.label: Realtime is critical
suggested_answers.description: Gaming, trading, collaboration tools requiring sub-second updates

messaging_queue.question: Do you expect background processing or asynchronous workflows that need queues?

suggested_answers.label: No background processing
suggested_answers.description: All operations complete synchronously in the request

suggested_answers.label: Some async processing
suggested_answers.description: Email sending, report generation, or simple jobs

suggested_answers.label: Heavy use of queues and async processing
suggested_answers.description: Complex workflows, event-driven architecture, or batch processing

scheduled_jobs.question: Do you need scheduled or cron-like jobs?

suggested_answers.label: A few scheduled tasks
suggested_answers.description: Daily reports, weekly cleanups, or periodic syncs

suggested_answers.label: Many scheduled tasks / batch jobs
suggested_answers.description: Complex scheduling with dependencies and monitoring

payments.question: Does the system handle payments, subscriptions, or financial transactions?

suggested_answers.label: No payments
suggested_answers.description: Free product or external payment handling

suggested_answers.label: Simple payments (e.g., Stripe)
suggested_answers.description: One-time payments or basic subscriptions via payment gateway

suggested_answers.label: Payments are core and complex (fintech-like)
suggested_answers.description: Multi-currency, ledgers, escrow, or regulatory requirements

search.question: Do you need full-text search or complex search/filtering?

suggested_answers.label: Basic filtering only
suggested_answers.description: Simple database queries with exact matches

suggested_answers.label: Simple search
suggested_answers.description: Text search across a few fields with basic relevance

suggested_answers.label: Advanced search with relevance and filters
suggested_answers.description: Elasticsearch-style with facets, fuzzy matching, and ranking

admin_dashboard.question: Will you need an internal admin panel or back-office dashboard?

suggested_answers.label: No admin dashboard
suggested_answers.description: Direct database access or no admin needs

suggested_answers.label: Simple admin panel
suggested_answers.description: User management and basic content moderation

suggested_answers.label: Complex admin/operations console
suggested_answers.description: Full operational dashboard with analytics and workflows

mobile_clients.question: Will native mobile apps (iOS/Android) be first-class clients?

suggested_answers.label: No, mainly web
suggested_answers.description: Browser-only access, responsive design for mobile

suggested_answers.label: Some mobile apps
suggested_answers.description: Native apps as secondary clients to web

suggested_answers.label: Mobile-first experience
suggested_answers.description: Native apps are the primary user interface

third_party_integrations.question: Do you require integrations with third-party systems (CRM, billing, identity, etc.)?

suggested_answers.label: No integrations
suggested_answers.description: Standalone system with no external dependencies

suggested_answers.label: A few standard integrations
suggested_answers.description: Common services like Stripe, SendGrid, or Google OAuth

suggested_answers.label: Many or complex integrations
suggested_answers.description: Enterprise systems, custom APIs, or bi-directional sync

stateful.question: Does your system need to store user or business data over time?

suggested_answers.label: No, it is stateless
suggested_answers.description: Processing only, no data persistence needed

suggested_answers.label: Yes, simple data
suggested_answers.description: User profiles, preferences, and basic records

suggested_answers.label: Yes, important or business-critical data
suggested_answers.description: Financial records, transactions, or regulated data

primary_data_model.question: What best describes your main data model?

suggested_answers.label: Relational data (tables, SQL)
suggested_answers.description: Structured data with relationships and transactions

suggested_answers.label: Key-value or cache-like
suggested_answers.description: Fast lookups by key, session storage

suggested_answers.label: Mixed / not sure
suggested_answers.description: Multiple data types or evolving requirements

data_volume.question: How much data do you expect to store in the next 12 months?

suggested_answers.label: Tiny (< 1 GB)
suggested_answers.description: Small app or prototype with minimal data

suggested_answers.label: Small (1–100 GB)
suggested_answers.description: Standard web app with moderate user base

suggested_answers.label: Large (1–10 TB)
suggested_answers.description: Enterprise scale with heavy data usage

suggested_answers.label: Huge (> 10 TB)
suggested_answers.description: Big data, analytics, or media-heavy platforms

data_growth_rate.question: How fast do you expect your stored data to grow?

suggested_answers.label: Slow
suggested_answers.description: Stable user base, minimal new data over time

suggested_answers.label: Fast
suggested_answers.description: Rapid user acquisition or high-volume data ingestion

data_sensitivity.question: How sensitive is the data you handle?

suggested_answers.label: Medium (basic personal data like names and emails)
High (financial, health, or other regulated data)

data_residency_required.question: Do you have strict data residency requirements (must stay in a certain country/region)?

suggested_answers.label: Legally required to stay in specific region
suggested_answers.description: GDPR, data sovereignty, or government mandates

backup_retention_days.question: How long do you need to keep backups?

suggested_answers.label: Short (<= 7 days)
suggested_answers.description: Quick recovery for recent issues only

suggested_answers.label: Standard (30 days)
suggested_answers.description: Monthly backup cycle for most applications

suggested_answers.label: Extended (90 days+)
suggested_answers.description: Quarterly retention for compliance or audits

estimated_mau.question: Approximately how many monthly active users do you expect?

suggested_answers.label: High (100,000 – 1,000,000)
suggested_answers.description: Popular app with significant user base

peak_rps.question: What is your expected peak request rate (across all users)?

suggested_answers.label: Very low (< 10 rps)
suggested_answers.description: Internal tools with minimal concurrent usage

suggested_answers.label: Medium (100 – 1,000 rps)
suggested_answers.description: Active user base with moderate concurrency

traffic_pattern.question: How does your traffic typically behave?

suggested_answers.label: Spiky (sudden bursts)
suggested_answers.description: Unpredictable peaks from viral content or alerts

suggested_answers.label: Seasonal (events/launches)
suggested_answers.description: Predictable high periods like holidays or releases

performance_sensitivity.question: How sensitive is your application to response times?

burstiness.question: Do you expect sudden bursts of traffic (e.g., campaigns, sales, launches)?

suggested_answers.label: Frequent or extreme bursts
suggested_answers.description: Flash sales, viral content, or live events

availability_target.question: What availability (uptime) target do you need?

suggested_answers.description: ~7 hours downtime/month, suitable for internal tools

recovery_time_objective.question: If there is an outage, how quickly must the system be back up (RTO)?

suggested_answers.label: Hours
suggested_answers.description: Non-critical systems, can wait for manual recovery

recovery_point_objective.question: How much data loss can you tolerate in a disaster (RPO)?

suggested_answers.label: Up to 24 hours
suggested_answers.description: Daily backups acceptable, some data loss OK

suggested_answers.label: Up to 1 hour
suggested_answers.description: Near real-time replication for critical data

suggested_answers.label: Only a few minutes
suggested_answers.description: Synchronous replication for zero data loss

multi_region_required.question: Do you require active multi-region setup for higher resilience or locality?

authentication_strength.question: What level of authentication strength do you need?

authorization_complexity.question: How complex are your access control needs?

regulatory_compliance.question: Do you need to comply with any specific regulations?

security_posture.question: How strict should your security posture be?

suggested_answers.label: Basic (small internal app, low risk)
suggested_answers.description: Standard security practices for low-risk apps

suggested_answers.label: Hardened (internet-facing production app)
suggested_answers.description: Security best practices for public applications

suggested_answers.label: Very strict / zero-trust-like (sensitive or regulated)
suggested_answers.description: Maximum security for regulated or sensitive data

observability_level.question: How deep do you want logging, metrics, and tracing?

suggested_answers.label: Basic logs only
suggested_answers.description: Error logs and basic application output

suggested_answers.label: Standard logs and metrics
suggested_answers.description: Structured logging with key performance metrics

suggested_answers.label: Advanced with traces, dashboards, alerts
suggested_answers.description: Full observability stack with APM and alerting

deployment_frequency.question: How often do you expect to deploy changes?

suggested_answers.label: Monthly or less
suggested_answers.description: Stable releases with planned maintenance windows

change_risk_tolerance.question: How much risk can you tolerate when deploying changes?

suggested_answers.label: Medium
suggested_answers.description: Standard rollouts with quick rollback capability

ops_team_maturity.question: How mature is your DevOps/SRE capability?

primary_region_hint.question: Where are most of your end users located, or which region do you prefer?

suggested_answers.label: US / North America
suggested_answers.description: Primary user base in the Americas

suggested_answers.label: Asia-Pacific
suggested_answers.description: Primary user base in Asia-Pacific region

suggested_answers.label: Latin America
suggested_answers.description: Primary user base in Latin America

suggested_answers.label: Middle East / Africa
suggested_answers.description: Primary user base in Middle East or Africa

provider_lock_in_sensitivity.question: How concerned are you about being locked into a single cloud provider?

suggested_answers.label: High concern
suggested_answers.description: Multi-cloud or vendor-neutral is a priority

ops_model.question: Do you prefer serverless, managed services, or Kubernetes-style control?

suggested_answers.label: No strong preference
suggested_answers.description: Open to recommendations based on requirements

managed_db_preference.question: Do you prefer fully managed databases or are you okay managing your own?

suggested_answers.label: Prefer fully managed DBs
suggested_answers.description: RDS, Cloud SQL, or similar managed services

suggested_answers.label: Self-managed DB is acceptable
suggested_answers.description: Running databases on VMs or containers

suggested_answers.label: No database needed
suggested_answers.description: Stateless application or external data source

kubernetes_required.question: Is running Kubernetes (e.g., EKS/AKS/GKE) a hard requirement for you?

domain_fintech.question: Is this a financial or fintech-related system (e.g., payments, trading, banking)?

suggested_answers.label: Some financial aspects
suggested_answers.description: Payment processing or financial data handling

suggested_answers.label: Primarily a fintech system
suggested_answers.description: Core banking, trading, or financial services

domain_healthcare.question: Is this a healthcare or medical-related system (e.g., patient data, diagnostics)?

suggested_answers.label: Primarily a healthcare/medical system
suggested_answers.description: Patient records, diagnostics, or clinical tools

domain_iot.question: Will you connect and manage physical devices or sensors (IoT)?

suggested_answers.label: Some devices
suggested_answers.description: A few connected devices or sensors

suggested_answers.label: Large-scale IoT deployment
suggested_answers.description: Thousands of devices with real-time data

domain_gaming.question: Is this a game backend or gaming-related platform?

domain_ml_heavy.question: Does your system rely heavily on machine learning (training or serving models)?

suggested_answers.label: ML-heavy (training and/or online inference)
suggested_answers.description: Custom model training and real-time inference

domain_internal_it.question: Is this primarily an internal IT/business tool rather than a public-facing product?

web_ui.question: Will there be a web user interface?

suggested_answers.label: Web UI is core experience
suggested_answers.description: Rich web application for end users

mobile_apps.question: Are native mobile apps part of the solution?

suggested_answers.label: Some mobile presence
suggested_answers.description: Companion apps or limited mobile features

suggested_answers.label: Mobile is primary channel
suggested_answers.description: Native apps are the main user interface

public_api.question: Will you expose a public API for external developers or clients?

suggested_answers.label: Public developer-facing API
suggested_answers.description: Open API with documentation and developer portal

cost_sensitivity.question: How important is minimizing cloud cost versus performance and flexibility?

project_lifetime.question: How long do you expect this project or system to live?

suggested_answers.label: Short PoC / experiment
suggested_answers.description: Proof of concept or temporary project
